name: triable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be judged by a trial in a court of law: Only very serious offences are triable in front of a jury. The accused woman is seriously ill and will remain in hospital until she is triable.
More examplesFewer examplesBecause a trial by jury is so expensive, many offences have now been made triable only by a magistrate.The pre-trial hearing determined that there was no triable issue of fact.Traditionally, this offence is triable only by a military commission.The judge determined that the case was not triable.
